Issues.Title: [NgZone] shouldCoalesceChangeDetection option results in infinite change detections
Issues.Body:
The `shouldCoalesceChangeDetection` option added in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/39422 results in infinite change detections done as a `requestAnimationFrame`.


### Repro ###

Repro: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-1ucpvz

This happens in an empty Angular app just by turning on the option:

```typescript
platformBrowserDynamic()
  .bootstrapModule(AppModule, {
    ngZoneRunCoalescing: true
  })
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[NgZone] shouldCoalesceChangeDetection option results in infinite change detections" (#41870)

Issues.Title: i18n tagged sub component inputs are bleeding interpolation values
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Relating to @angular/localize and Ivy rendering ### Is this a regression? Unsure, as this project was created for Angular 11. ### Description When passing multiple interpolated values into a sub component and marking those inputs as `i18n-`, the dynamic portion of the input is bleeding into the next dynamic input. ```html ``` This error occurs when running before and after extraction and in develop or production configurations. This issue disappears when disabling Ivy but we would prefer to continue with Ivy given its benefits. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction A stackblitz has been created but does not present the problem. This is likely due to stackblitz and Ivy issues. A github repo has been provided to present the problem locally with Ivy running correctly. - stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/test-angular-i18n-interpolation?file=src/polyfills.ts - github: https://github.com/calummm/test-angular-i18n-interpolation The application can be started with the standard `npm i` `npm start` commands. There is a single page displaying a subcomponent with expected and actual values. The first sub component has i18n attributes, the second does not. test with i18n "braces again" is showing an incorrect actual of `1` instead of `3`. \ test with i18n "multi" is showing an incorrect actual of `1 3 1` instead of `1 2 3` ## üî• Exception or Error No explicit error message ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


Angular CLI: 11.2.11
Node: 12.18.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): only one listener should also throw an error
Issues.Body:
Close #41867

In the previous commit https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/41562#issuecomment-822696973,
the error thrown in the event listener will be caught and re-thrown, but there is a bug
in the commit, if there is only one listener for the specified event name, the error
will not be re-thrown, so this commit fixes the issue and make sure the error is re-thrown.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(zone.js): only one listener should also throw an error" (#41868)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): prefer non-aliased exports in reference emitters
Issues.Body:
This commit changes the reference emitters in the Ivy compiler to prefer
non-aliased exports if they exist. This avoids selecting "private
exports" that may not be stable, e.g. the reexports that have been added
by the View Engine compiler. Such reexports are not stable and are
therefore not suitable to be emitted into partial compilations, as the
output of partial compilations should only reference stable symbols
from upstream libraries.

An alternative solution has been considered where ViewEngine-generated
exports would gain a certain prefix, such that the Ivy compiler could
just exclude those exports (see #41443). However, that solution would
be insufficient in case a library is built using partial compilation and
using a VE-compiled library from earlier versions of Angular, where the
magic prefix would be missing. For such libraries, ngcc would have
generated reexports using the declared name if not already present so
this change does result in choosing the correct export.

Because ngcc always generates reexports using the declared name even if
an aliased export is present, this change causes those ngcc-generated
exports to be chosen in downstream libraries using partial compilation.
This is unfortunate as it means that the declared names become
effectively public even if the library author was intentionally
exporting it using an alias. This commit does not address this problem;
it is expected that this should not result in widespread issues across
the library ecosystem.

Fixes #41277
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): prefer non-aliased exports in reference emitters" (#41866)

Issues.Title: [11.2.x] build: update remark packages
Issues.Body:
_This is a backport of #41721 to the `11.2.x` branch._

##
This PR updates the `remark` packages to v12 instead of the latest (v13), because v13 is a major breaking change that requires more investigation and work.

More specifically, v13 replaces the internals of `remark` with a new CommonMark-compliant parser.
(See their [release notes][1] for more info.)

This change causes our old `remark` plugins (in [renderMarkdown.js][2]) to stop working.

[1]: https://github.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/tag/13.0.0
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d42019d4128ca0d9f233a085bfe838f93f8d0412/aio/tools/transforms/remark-package/services/renderMarkdown.js#L17-L24
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[11.2.x] build: update remark packages" (#41862)

Issues.Title: [11.2.x] ci: prevent CI cache from growing indefinitely
Issues.Body:
_This is a backport of #41814 to the `11.2.x` branch._

##
Previously, the fallback key used for the CircleCI cache could match a cache indefinitely (as long as `.bazelversion` didn't change). This would allow the cache to grow quite large, which in turn would lead to slow-down in CI jobs. See, also, angular/angular-cli#17533 for more details of the impact of a growing CircleCI cache.

Unfortunately, using something like the lockfile checksum in the fallback cache key would cause too many cache misses (esp. with automatic updates via Renovate), again slowing CI down.

(The problem was originally discussed [here][2].)

This commit uses the technique described in [this blogpost][1] to invalidate the cache monthly. This keeps the extra cache misses low (essentially once per month per fork), while also preventing the cache from growing indefinitely.

[1]: https://support.circleci.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012618473-Creating-a-daily-cache
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/41467#discussion_r607818494
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[11.2.x] ci: prevent CI cache from growing indefinitely" (#41855)

Issues.Title: @angular/language-service doesn't infer types from pipes with class-level generics
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler or @angular/language-service ### Is this a regression? Maybe? I don't know. This may never have worked. Stackblitz doesn't show the error when running with Angular 11 deps, so maybe? ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... As seen in: https://github.com/rx-angular/rx-angular/issues/634 Create a pipe with a class-level generic type argument that is used as a return value in the `transform(...)` method signature. All type information is subsequently lost during compilation of the template, and variables resolve as "unknown" type: Here for example, `md.isMobile$` is an `Observable`: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/362329/116436008-f7349800-a819-11eb-9ee3-073ca67a68e3.png) In the pushPipe implementation: ``` // Replacing this: export class PushPipe implements PipeTransform, OnDestroy { transform (...): U { } } // With this: export class PushPipe implements PipeTransform, OnDestroy { transform (...): U { } } ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Broken: ``` @Pipe({ name: 'push', pure: false }) export class PushPipe implements PipeTransform { transform(obj: Observable): U | null | undefined { return null; } } ``` Works: ``` @Pipe({ name: 'push', pure: false }) export class PushPipe implements PipeTransform { transform(obj: Observable): U | null | undefined { return null; } } ``` https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-zdl5xa?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html ## üî• Exception or Error 

[ng]     Error occurs in the template of component TestPage.
[ng] Error: src/app/pages/test.page.html:10:40 - error TS2339: Property 'type' does not exist on type 'unknown'.
[ng] 10                     format="{{ payload.type }}">
[ng]

Issues.Title: onPush Change detection - complex object values are getting updated even if you are mutating the Object.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular-devkit/core 11.2.10 @angular-devkit/schematics 11.2.10 @angular/cli 11.2.10 ### Is this a regression? I tested this same behavior in Angular 8, and it was working as per the angular docs ### Description While choosing onPush change detection strategy, if I pass values from parent to child component using @input parameters like **number** (primitive) and a **string array** (reference), it gets updated in the child every time even I am not changing the reference of string array[]. **On the other hand**, as per docs, in the onPush scenario, we need to change the reference of the complex object to get the updated values to reflect in the child component. The same scenario works differently if I only pass string[] as @input to my child. In this case, updating the array values in the parent doesn't get reflected in the child component. Once I change the reference on a string[] then only its value gets updated in the child component for your reference, I am passing two variables in the below fashion... @Input() inputNumber: number; @Input() arrItems: string[]; ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rvmqxu ## üî• Exception or Error No error in the chrome dev tool, but the application should not behave in this manner ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.10
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.10
@angular/cli                    11.2.10
@schematics/angular             11.2.10
@schematics/update              0.1102.10
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "onPush Change detection - complex object values are getting updated even if you are mutating the Object." (#41853)

Issues.Title: build: update dependency terser to v5
Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [terser](https://terser.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser)) | [`^4.3.1` -> `^5.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/terser/4.8.0/5.7.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/compatibility-slim/4.8.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/confidence-slim/4.8.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |
| [terser](https://terser.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser)) | [`^4.4.0` -> `^5.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/terser/4.8.0/5.7.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/compatibility-slim/4.8.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/terser/5.7.0/confidence-slim/4.8.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>terser/terser</summary>

### [`v5.7.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v570)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.6.1...8f69f4af157fb40470ea4700a02dfb3cb0c8abda)

-   Several compile-time evaluation and inlining fixes
-   Allow `reduce_funcs` to be disabled again.
-   Add `spidermonkey` options to parse and format ([#​974](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/974))
-   Accept `{get = "default val"}` and `{set = "default val"}` in destructuring arguments.
-   Change package.json export map to help require.resolve ([#​971](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/971))
-   Improve docs
-   Fix `export default` of an anonymous class with `extends`

### [`v5.6.1`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v561)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.6.0...v5.6.1)

-   Mark assignments to the `.prototype` of a class as pure
-   Parenthesize `await` on the left of `**` (while accepting legacy non-parenthesised input)
-   Avoided outputting NUL bytes in optimized RegExps, to stop the output from breaking other tools
-   Added `exports` to domprops ([#​939](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/939))
-   Fixed a crash when spreading `...this`
-   Fixed the computed size of arrow functions, which improves their inlining

### [`v5.6.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v560)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.5.1...v5.6.0)

-   Added top-level await
-   Beautify option has been removed in [#​895](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/895)
-   Private properties, getters and setters have been added in [#​913](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/913) and some more commits
-   Docs improvements: [#​896](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/896), [#​903](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/903), [#​916](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/issues/916)

### [`v5.5.1`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v551)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.5.0...v5.5.1)

-   Fixed object properties with unicode surrogates on safari.

### [`v5.5.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v550)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.4.0...v5.5.0)

-   Fixed crash when inlining uninitialized variable into template string.
-   The sourcemap for dist was removed for being too large.

### [`v5.4.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v540)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.8...v5.4.0)

-   Logical assignment
-   Change `let x = undefined` to just `let x`
-   Removed some optimizations for template strings, placing them behind `unsafe` options. Reason: adding strings is not equivalent to template strings, due to valueOf differences.
-   The AST_Token class was slimmed down in order to use less memory.

### [`v5.3.8`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v538)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.7...v5.3.8)

-   Restore node 13 support

### [`v5.3.7`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v537)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.6...v5.3.7)

Hotfix release, fixes package.json "engines" syntax

### [`v5.3.6`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v536)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.5...v5.3.6)

-   Fixed parentheses when outputting `??` mixed with `||` and `&&`
-   Improved hygiene of the symbol generator

### [`v5.3.5`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v535)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.4...v5.3.5)

-   Avoid moving named functions into default exports.
-   Enabled transform() for chain expressions. This allows AST transformers to reach inside chain expressions.

### [`v5.3.4`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v534)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.3...v5.3.4)

-   Fixed a crash when hoisting (with `hoist_vars`) a destructuring variable declaration

### [`v5.3.3`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v533)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.2...v5.3.3)

-   `source-map` library has been updated, bringing memory usage and CPU time improvements when reading input source maps (the SourceMapConsumer is now WASM based).
-   The `wrap_func_args` option now also wraps arrow functions, as opposed to only function expressions.

### [`v5.3.2`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v532)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.1...v5.3.2)

-   Prevented spread operations from being expanded when the expanded array/object contains getters, setters, or array holes.
-   Fixed _very_ slow self-recursion in some cases of removing extraneous parentheses from `+` operations.

### [`v5.3.1`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v531)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.3.0...v5.3.1)

-   An issue with destructuring declarations when `pure_getters` is enabled has been fixed
-   Fixed a crash when chain expressions need to be shallowly compared
-   Made inlining functions more conservative to make sure a function that contains a reference to itself isn't moved into a place that can create multiple instances of itself.

### [`v5.3.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v530)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.2.1...v5.3.0)

-   Fixed a crash when compressing object spreads in some cases
-   Fixed compiletime evaluation of optional chains (caused typeof a?.b to always return "object")
-   domprops has been updated to contain every single possible prop

### [`v5.2.1`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v521)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.2.0...v5.2.1)

-   The parse step now doesn't accept an `ecma` option, so that all ES code is accepted.
-   Optional dotted chains now accept keywords, just like dotted expressions (`foo?.default`)

### [`v5.2.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v520)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.1.0...v5.2.0)

-   Optional chaining syntax is now supported.
-   Consecutive await expressions don't have unnecessary parens
-   Taking the variable name's length (after mangling) into consideration when deciding to inline

### [`v5.1.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v510)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v5.0.0...v5.1.0)

-   `import.meta` is now supported
-   Typescript typings have been improved

### [`v5.0.0`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v500)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v4.8.0...v5.0.0)

-   `in` operator now taken into account during property mangle.
-   Fixed infinite loop in face of a reference loop in some situations.
-   Kept exports and imports around even if there's something which will throw before them.
-   The main exported bundle for commonjs, dist/bundle.min.js is no longer minified.

</details>

---

### [`v6.0.0`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/6.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/5.0.0...6.0.0)

**Breaking Changes**

-   Import map scopes now require a trailing `/` ([#​2009](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/2009))
-   JSON and Wasm modules are no longer supported by default in s.js and system.js. Instead, use the new [module-types extra](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/blob/master/docs/module-types.md)
-   Deps argument added to onload hook ([#​1998](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/pull/1998))
-   System.resolve is now synchronous by default in both s.js and system.js ([#​1996](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/pull/1996) and [#​1939](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1939), [@​joeldenning](https://togithub.com/joeldenning))

Features

-   CSS modules can now be loaded by s.js and system.js. [Docs](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/blob/master/docs/module-types.md#css-modules) ([#​1997](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1997))
-   Cascading/Composing import maps are now supported. [Docs](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/blob/master/docs/import-maps.md#composition) ([#​2009](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/2009))
-   New module types extra for CSS, JSON and Wasm ([#​2006](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/pull/2006))
-   The first named System.regiser in a bundle will now define the bundle module itself. This avoids need for double `System.import()` ([#​1984](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/pull/1984), [@​joeldenning](https://togithub.com/joeldenning))

Patches

-   Named exports extra fix to not alter the default export ([#​1983](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/pull/1983), [@​joeldenning](https://togithub.com/joeldenning))

### [`v0.21.1`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.21.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.21.0...0.21.1)

Updates SystemJS production loader to support `System.config({ wasm: true })` with `WebAssembly.compileStreaming`.

### [`v0.21.0`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.21.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.20.19...0.21.0)

This release represents a new build of the 6KB SystemJS production loader with the following changes:

-   Support for loading modules as AMD falling back to global detection ([#​1778](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1778))
-   AMD modules are treated as having the shape `{ default: module }` through System.import instead of returning the default directly (this will ensure dynamic import workflows work out correctly) ([#​1786](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1786))

Now that Rollup supports the `system` module format and code splitting, this will allow easy production workflows against chunking and CDN externals.

### [`v0.20.13`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.20.13)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.20.12...0.20.13)

Features

-   Fixes default import interop for \_\_esModule cases where exports.default is provided only (see Module Loader release notes at <https://github.com/ModuleLoader/es-module-loader/releases/tag/2.2.0>)
-   Errors are now cached in the loader registry to match the WhatWG HTML module script loading algorithm (<https://github.com/ModuleLoader/es-module-loader/releases/tag/2.2.0>). Errors can only be cleared by using the `System.registry.delete` API.
-   Prepares the way for `import.meta.url` transformers

Bug Fixes

-   URL resolution fixed to support treating `./x:y` as a relative not an absolute url.

-   Fixes a mapping bug in the production loader ([`13df95c`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/13df95c4823c860bf4967326339dc9de617b1b0a))
-   Fixes to URI encoding in Node ([`6999314`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/6999314e9259a5cf5c911481a8c81d81dee34c49), [`8465358`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/846535858b4852447190f102f118bd97c58cf47c))

### [`v0.20.0`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.20.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.19.47...0.20.0)

SystemJS 0.20 is a rewrite of SystemJS on top of the 2.0 release of [es-module-loader](https://togithub.com/ModuleLoader/es-module-loader).
It remains as backwards-compatible as possible, while also tracking the changes of direction
that have been happening at the specification level.

There are a number of breaking changes and deprecations as listed below.

To upgrade, first run SystemJS 0.19 with System.config({ warnings: true }) and fix all the deprecation
warnings first before running SystemJS 0.20.

The corresponding release of SystemJS Builder is available at <https://github.com/systemjs/builder/releases/tag/0.16.0>.

_For background on this release, see the blog post at <http://guybedford.com/systemjs-alignment>._

New Features:

-   Improved performance and reduced file size.
-   Supports the dynamic import('./module.js') syntax in modules, when
    transpiled with the Babel system module format with the babel-plugin-syntax-dynamic-import plugin enabled (alternatively this support is also provided by the SystemJS babel plugin).
-   Supports automatically loading Web Assembly when enabled via the flag System.config({ wasm: true })
-   New small optimized production build (5KB) for just loading System.register modules with baseURL, paths, map, contextual map, bundles, depCache and wasm support.
-   Normalization is now fully idempotent
-   format: 'system' is supported as an alternative to format: 'register'

Breaking Changes:

-   Removes the ability to use named imports from non-ES modules (eg import {readFile} from 'fs' should be import fs from 'fs'; fs.readFile). This is in order to align with the NodeJS ES module directions ([nodejs/CTC#​60](https://togithub.com/nodejs/CTC/pull/60/files#diff-2b572743d67d8a47685ae4bcb9bec651R217)).
-   Removes support for defaultJSExtensions
-   Default transpiler loading is removed. It is no longer possible to transpile sources without configuring one of the transpiler plugins.
-   Setting baseURL directly is no longer supported - use System.config({ baseURL: 'x' }) over System.baseURL = x.
-   No longer possible to set System.map['x'] = 'asdf'. Must use System.config({ map: { x: 'asdf' } }).
-   Hooks no longer exist (just resolve and instantiate as in es-module-loader). Hooks via plugins still work fine.
-   Supports IE9+ but scriptLoad support is only included in IE11+
-   deps is no longer supported for System.register / System.registerDynamic / script load
-   Global exports metadata as an array will no longer export the default as the first global.
-   format: 'esm' must now be used instead of format: 'es6'
-   A bundle with a single named System.register statement will no longer give an anonymous module value
-   No more special handling of trailing slash in CJS
-   System.load now does normalization, to match WhatWG spec. This method may well be deprecated as idempotent normalization should make this no longer necessary.
-   AMD define no longer set by default when using scriptLoad, requires manually setting window.define = System.amdDefine for scriptLoad support of AMD.
-   The separate SystemCSP and register builds are no longer available
-   Disables a previous experimental functional return variation of System.register
-   Alias feature is removed
-   System and SystemJS globals are no longer defined in NodeJS

Bug Fixes

-   depCache now uses link preloading instead of partial execution techniques which have been unreliable.

-   All exceptions now include the text `(SystemJS)` for easy identification as some stacks lack any reference to SystemJS itself ([#​1309](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1309))
-   Support for recursive package map via simple recursion detection. This allows the recursive map `map: { './lib': './lib/index.js' }` in a package to enable full support for CommonJS directory require use cases ([#​1164](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1164))
-   Simple naive support for `module.paths` and `module.require` for better CommonJS compatibility ([`36ab9d4`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/36ab9d414894a4c22100807c8c07ac0562316c32))
-   Various refactorings with some minor performance improvements ([`82c9760`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/82c9760f7d7b4d199e71850af42c70c092aa67a7), [`6e82edc`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/6e82edc60a60f6073ab594d9c7e5688e8511ccf6))

Bug Fixes

-   Fixes nwjs execution support in shared context ([#​1290](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1290))
-   `import '@​node/x'` will now properly scope the Node require ([`6443c88`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/6443c8829ffe3397d8b7dfc99fb9942073f333a6))
-   IE8 fixes ([`c461dfc`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/c461dfc1e95508e15b41a660282a9ef9cec7de3d))
-   Fix support for `scriptLoad: true` meta to work against `builder.compile` single file output ([`e085343`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/e0853435c7c50180009573077a5b553c1e440583), [`428b16e`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/428b16e69351faa22ea51cd6188d14f705968103))

### [`v0.19.29`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.19.29)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.19.28...0.19.29)

-   Ensure `System` is properly scoped to the current loader ([`e0e6102`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/e0e6102cb2ba7ff5db4af68ba532b41908e14c9d))
-   `System.getConfig` implementation for future upgrade path ([`de8e180`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/de8e1807bfb6ac22d5f838f279e4083547bca798))
-   Plugin normalize to use plugin loader normalize for consistency ([`0073661`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/007366193e0a13fd95e4fd10e558211f19d03d23))

### [`v0.19.28`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.19.28)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.19.27...0.19.28)

Features

-   Support `metadata.deps` properly for es modules ([`273432b`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/273432b689e68a29b89a34565f5547921ba4f772))
-   Support for `System.config({ nodeConfig: {}, browserConfig: {}, devConfig: {} })` environment configuration overrides which only apply in the given environment ([`25eca2d`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/25eca2d104c00e97693593ad7fce255bef3ee021))
-   Support for `import electron from '@​node/electron'` in Electron ([#​1261](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1261))
-   Node sourcemap fixes ([#​1216](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1216))
-   Support `encapsulateGlobals` for global modules ([#​960](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/960))
-   Package conditional map now supports arbitrary conditions ([`b4c0284`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/b4c0284a594367790035f1441b4b599d14e0cdef))

Bug Fixes

-   Fix parsing offset of comments right before require statements stopping require extraction in latest Babel ([`6fb3344`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/6fb3344b638ad4e7e92adfff5ef45fbda70408cc))
-   Allow anonymous and named System.register in the same module ([#​1262](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1262))
-   hasOwnProperty fix for IE ([#​1210](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1210))
-   Package format metadata to not apply to plugin loads ([#​1250](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1250))
-   Fix to ensure the global is never exported via named exports ([`ec257c7`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/ec257c72e9edf867f79066924de5cbf9f167a133))
-   Begin deprecation of wildcard paths ([`e5dc669`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/e5dc6690cb5cbc482cfaf61cebd872bb9c2cf733))
-   Don't use the default getting with getEsModule ([`2c33f88`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/2c33f882e7fa44a63f702ac8fe3588d6c7325016))
-   Ensure conditional package map to conditional substitution gets default package extension ([#​1269](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1269))
-   Always respect the existing window.onerror ([`efb268d`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/efb268dd4c93d66763024a2b667d8f22768a7f65))
-   Relax source maps sanitization for plugins and transpilers ([`b124515`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/b124515f09d9d79ce137af1a03c5fc67270c2180))

### [`v0.19.27`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/releases/0.19.27)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.19.26...0.19.27)

-   Restricts package to needed files for publishing ([`e60adb9`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/e60adb92e67a40e0f1b31ea101adb1be0b777f0f))
-   Fix to ensure package configurations are never loaded through plugins ([`9f56903`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/9f5690383489422314f984531bf8242123a899eb))
-   Ensure scriptLoad and empty sources are not evaluated for CSP compatibility ([`8d64131`](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/commit/8d64131a03ad171b452d83dcda59a574ee27e037), [#​1245](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/issues/1245))

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/systemjs/systemjs/compare/0.19.25...0.19.26)

Bug Fixes

### [`v18.0.0`](https://togithub.com/octokit/rest.js/releases/v18.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/octokit/rest.js/compare/v17.11.2...v18.0.0)

##### Upgrade guide

Install the latest v17 version (`17.11.2` as of this writing). Run your tests and address all deprecation messages. Once all deprecations have been addressed, the upgrade to v18 should be easy. The only changes are removals of previously deprecated APIs.

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   `Octokit.plugin()` no longer accepts an array as first argument. Pass multiple arguments instead, e.g. `Octokit.plugin(plugin1, plugin2)`
-   deprecated `octokit.reactions.deleteLegacy()` has been removed
-   deprecated `octokit.repos.getDownloads()` has been removed
-   deprecated `octokit.repos.listDownloads()` has been removed
-   deprecated `octokit.repos.deleteDownloads()` has been removed
-   `octokit.actions.createOrUpdateRepoSecret()`: parameter `name` has been renamed to `secret_name`

Before

```js
const options = octokit.issues.listForRepo.endpoint.merge({
  owner: "octokit",
  repo: "rest.js",
});
const issues = await octokit.paginate(options);
```

After

```js
const issues = await octokit.paginate(octokit.issues.listForRepo, {
  owner: "octokit",
  repo: "rest.js",
});
```

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update dependency @octokit/rest to v18" (#41846)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): do not redirect disambiguated URLs (and other related infrastruture fixes)
Issues.Body:
In #41788, logic was added to disambiguate case-insensitively equal docs paths/URLs. This process includes appending a `-\d+` suffix to some paths/URLs (for example, `/.../inject-1`). Unfortunately, some of the Firebase redirects configured in `firebase.json` would match these URLs and redirect them to non-existing paths.
Example failures: [stable][1], [next][2]

NOTE:
This was not picked up in the regular CI tests run for PRs, because the local devserver and the preview server used to test PRs do not support Firebase-like redirects.

This PR fixes this by ensuring these disambiguated paths/URLs are not matched by the redirect rules by checking whether the part of the suffix after the `-` contains any numeric digits. While this check is not ideal, it should be good enough for our purpose, since the legacy URLs that we do want to redirect contain suffixes such as `-class`, `-function` and thus no numeric digits.

This PR also includes related infrastructure/testing fixes to allow implementing the fix. See the individual commits for details.

[1]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/974345
[2]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/974346

Issues.Title: Skip ngcc when `npm install` is ran
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] doc
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [X] Other - `npm install`

### Description
When running `npm install` in a project, there are cases which we do not want the `ngcc` to execute. Eg running other commands in the same project on a CI.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Ideally to skip the ngcc compilation stage when `npm install`. Cypress has a similar feature which is set via an environment variable. https://docs.cypress.io/guides/getting-started/installing-cypress#Install-binary

My suggestion would be something like this

`NG_SKIP_GCC=true npm install`

Followed by a message eg:
`Skipping Angular Compiler (ngcc) as NG_SKIP_GCC is set to true`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Skipping any npm scripts (via npm install --ignore-scripts), but this can only be done at a project level .
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Skip ngcc when `npm install` is ran" (#20648)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): fix migration for namedChunks option
Issues.Body: The value for `namedChunk` was inverted, as previously `namedChunks` default value was `true` and not `false`.

Issues.Body:

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [stylus-loader](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader) | [`4.3.3` -> `5.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/stylus-loader/4.3.3/5.0.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/stylus-loader/5.0.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/stylus-loader/5.0.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/stylus-loader/5.0.0/compatibility-slim/4.3.3)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/stylus-loader/5.0.0/confidence-slim/4.3.3)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/stylus-loader</summary>

### [`v5.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​500-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribstylus-loadercomparev433v500-2021-02-02)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/compare/v4.3.3...v5.0.0)

##### Notes

-   using `~` is deprecated and can be removed from your code (**we recommend it**), but we still support it for historical reasons. 

Why you can removed it?
The loader will first try to resolve `@import`/`@require` as relative, if it cannot be resolved, the loader will try to resolve `@import`/`@require` inside [`node_modules`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-modules).

##### :warning: BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported `webpack` version is `5`

##### Features

-   supported the [`resolve.byDependency`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolvebydependency) option, you can setup `{ resolve: { byDependency: { stylus: { mainFiles: ['custom', '...'] } } } }`

##### [4.3.3](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/compare/v4.3.2...v4.3.3) (2021-01-15)

##### Bug Fixes

-   respect the `compress` option ([#​303](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/issues/303)) ([e964abc](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/commit/e964abcf18147c1a3894e47cc9e8970379ae33e6))

##### [4.3.2](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/compare/v4.3.1...v4.3.2) (2021-01-09)

##### Bug Fixes

-   convert relative paths to absolute paths in dependencies ([#​301](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/issues/301)) ([3ded080](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/commit/3ded080fdc0425c3ebdf41f3204a36bae2eaa02c))

##### [4.3.1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/compare/v4.3.0...v4.3.1) (2020-12-02)

##### Bug Fixes

-   prevent search nested imports in css files ([#​298](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/issues/298)) ([092e52a](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/stylus-loader/commit/092e52a5463f7997b3a9545bf636f3bee8fd9dd3))

</details>

Issues.Title: MatTabGroup pagination chevron incorrect color when using backgroundColor property
Issues.Body:
**What is the expected behavior?**
mat-tab-group pagination chevron should be correct contrast color

**What is the current behavior?**
https://stackblitz.com/angular/manempdpqjo?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftab-group-theme-example.ts

CSS selector for mat-tab-header-pagination-chevron is broken for mat-tab-group and only works for mat-tab-nav-bar

Screenshot from Angular Material docs example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17053390/116463878-40481480-a839-11eb-9e5d-a04e235c9f78.png)

This selector specifically is broken as .mat-tab-header-pagination is not a direct child of .mat-tab-group
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17053390/116463701-0119c380-a839-11eb-9045-454254440f01.png)

**What are the steps to reproduce?**
go to this stackblitz and shrink screen on blue background mat-tab-group until the pagination chevrons appear
https://stackblitz.com/angular/manempdpqjo?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftab-group-theme-example.ts

**Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?**
11 (confirmed this was working in 10), all browsers and OS affected
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTabGroup pagination chevron incorrect color when using backgroundColor property" (#22587)

Issues.Title: build: remove dependency on @angular/elements and custom elements polyfill
Issues.Body: We weren't using `@angular/elements` for anything and the `custom-elements` polyfill was only included because of it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: remove dependency on @angular/elements and custom elements polyfill" (#22586)

Issues.Title: Issue(drag and drop): can`t handle scroll of list inside list
Issues.Body:
Hello, i have a structure when my drag and drop list is inside another drag and drop list and i need to drop elements from the third list to second. Item from list 3 shouldn t be dropped inside list 1 but in list 2. However autoscroll of list 1 does not work when i drag item from list 3 so i ve implemented custom scroll. Then i`ve faced an issue when i scroll list 1 -  placeholder is not moved with cursor (i saw in native material autoscroll this issue resolved by resorting items and move placeholder for a diference in scroll). Is it possible to make this sorting available for material user?

`<mat-list #list1> `

` <mat-list-item>`
`<mat-list #list2> `
`</mat-list>`
`</mat-list-item>`

`</mat-list>`

`<mat-list #list3> `
`</mat-list>`

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ui7u9m-5w9as5?file=src/app/cdk-drag-drop-disabled-sorting-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. drag item from second list to the green list 
2. scrol first list a bit while dragging 
3. see white placeholder not on the same line with dragged item

![Screenshot 2021-04-28 110528](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36365097/116369937-96559180-a812-11eb-83a9-cf36f75160bc.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue(drag and drop): can`t handle scroll of list inside list" (#22580)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Drag&Drop): Drag Events with typos
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

A series of events on the Drag & Drop documentation are mispelled. 
It indicates like:

cdkDragStart, cdkDragEnd or cdkDragMove

and the correct are:

cdkDragStart**ed**, cdkDragEnd**ed** or cdkDragMov**ed**

Don't know how many may be wrong. But I'm positive sure that you were already alerted on this issue.
So its just a reminder

**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/api#CdkDragMove
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "docs-bug(Drag&Drop): Drag Events with typos" (#22569)

Issues.Title: fix(material/tabs): update tab nav bar focused index on direct focus
Issues.Body:
The tab nav bar allows navigation both through tabbing and keyboard events. This introduces a problem when the user tabs into it and then starts using the arrow keys, because the `ListKeyManager` state isn't up-to-date.

These changes add some logic to update the index when the tabs receives focus.

Fixes #22576.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tabs): update tab nav bar focused index on direct focus" (#22584)

Issues.Title: docs(tree): A11Y improvement for Nested Tree example.
Issues.Body: Fixes #22517
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(tree): A11Y improvement for Nested Tree example." (#22583)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-slider): sync ui on pointerdown
Issues.Body:
* The MDC Foundation stores the bounding client rect when layout is first called.
  This means that if the position of the slider changes after the initial layout,
  the slider will break. To fix this broken behavior, we just call layout on
  pointerdown
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-slider): sync ui on pointerdown" (#22579)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): update mixin functions to avoid unknown cast
Issues.Body: Reworks the mixin functions in order to remove a workaround where we had to cast to `unknown`. The cast was causing some issues with Closure compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): update mixin functions to avoid unknown cast" (#22577)

Issues.Title: refactor(multiple): resolve rxjs 7 compilation errors
Issues.Body:
Fixes a few places that will become compilation errors in rxjs version 7. All of the changes are backwards-compatible so we can merge them now so that we have less issues to resolve once we make the switch.

**Note:** I'm marking this as merge safe, because all of the changes are internal and they only affect type information. There are a couple of extra null checks, but they're in `cdk-experimental` which is also merge safe.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(multiple): resolve rxjs 7 compilation errors" (#22566)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): support for date range input in MDC-based form field
Issues.Body:
Resolves a few issues that were preventing the use of the range picker with an MDC-based `mat-form-field`. Including:
1. Conditionally setting the `mat-mdc-input-element` class so that the input is sized correctly.
2. Triggering a state change event when the focus state changes so that the floating label is up-to-date.
3. Fixing an error being thrown inside `_shouldHideSeparator`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/datepicker): support for date range input in MDC-based form field" (#22565)

Issues.Title: help(Datepicker): Datepicker not working with timestamp as input value with moment-date-adapter
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->



**What are you trying to do?**  
I trying to use timestamp as input value for mat-datepicker


**What are you seeing that does not match your expectations?** 
The date adapter is ignoring my parse configuration setted to "X" as [Moment Documentation](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) says I have to set if input value is a timestamp. 

#### Reproduction
I attach this stackblitz where you can see the parse configuration for input is an "X" and the initial value is a timestamp which mat-datepicker can't recognize until I select the first value.

[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-evhhwk?file=package.json](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-evhhwk?file=package.json)


Steps to reproduce:
1. Open stackblitz and see initial value below mat-datepicker. It's supposed timestamp is supported but doesn't being recognized by datepicker
2. Select a date from picker and you can see it isn't doing conversion to the variable but display is showing the right timestamp.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.0
- CDK/Material: 11.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help(Datepicker): Datepicker not working with timestamp as input value with moment-date-adapter" (#22568)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-list): avoid style conflicts with other list-based components
Issues.Body:
Currently the styles for the MDC-based list are included globally which causes conflicts with other list-based components like `mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete`. This can be seen by going to the MDC list demo and then the MDC select demo, and observing that the option text is now truncated.

These changes resolve the issue by nesting the styles under the `mat-mdc-list-base` class.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-list): avoid style conflicts with other list-based components" (#22562)

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/a11y): only check for high contrast mode once
Issues.Body:
I noticed this in the profiler while working on https://github.com/angular/material.angular.io/pull/961. The `_applyBodyHighContrastModeCssClasses` method is called in the constructor of the `A11yModule` and `MatCommonModule` which means that it'll be invoked whenever a new root injector is created for a module importing any Material module (e.g. lazy-loaded route or dynamically-created component). Since it calls into `getHighContrastMode` and it touches the class list of `document.body`, it has the potential of causing some some slow layouts. This can be observed either when switching pages in the dev app or by profiling the example creation on material.angular.io.

These changes resolve the issue by ensuring that we only run the logic once.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/a11y): only check for high contrast mode once" (#22561)
